subject: Business
title: Price Anchoring in Retail
description: A micro-lesson that makes Price Anchoring in Retail usable.

hook.text: A jacket originally $400, now $199. You feel like you saved $201. But was it ever really $400?

buildup.text: Price anchoring sets a high reference point so the actual price feels like a bargain.

discovery.text: The original price is the anchor. Every discount is evaluated against it, regardless of the true cost.

twist.text: J.C. Penney dropped fake sales and showed honest prices. Sales collapsed. Customers missed 'the deal.'

climax.text: People don't buy based on value. They buy based on perceived savings from the anchor.

punchline.text: The first price you see isn't the real price. It's the setup.

quiz.question: What happened when J.C. Penney eliminated fake sale prices?
options: Sales collapsed because customers missed the perception of getting a deal
Customers praised the honesty and stayed loyal
